byline.original: Special to The New York Times
Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Argentines spread out the red carpet yesterday when Alberto Gainza Paz, owner and publisher of La Prensa of Buenos Aires, came back after four and a half years of exile to resume publication of that great newspaper in freedom.
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentines spread out the red carpet yesterday when Alberto Gainza Paz, owner and publisher of La Prensa of Buenos Aires, came back after four and a half years of exile to resume publication of that great newspaper in freedom.

docs.snippet: Varig Airlines of Brazil is planning an extensive tourist promotional campaign to increase travel and mutual understanding between the United States and Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: Varig Airlines of Brazil is planning an extensive tourist promotional campaign to increase travel and mutual understanding between the United States and Brazil.
docs.abstract: Varig dir-pres Berta to promote tourism; co to start wkly cargo flight, add 3d wkly passenger flight, NYC-Buenos Aires

headline.main: AIRLINE IN BRAZIL TO SEEK TOURISTS; Varig's Head Tells of Plans to Add to Understanding With United States

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 3--Luis Batlle Berres, Uruguay's head of Government, leaves tomorrow for the United States on an official visit that has raised quite a storm here.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 3--Luis Batlle Berres, Uruguay's head of Government, leaves tomorrow for the United States on an official visit that has raised quite a storm here.

headline.main: URUGUAY LEADER OFF TO U.S. TODAY; Battle Berres Denies He Will Seek Loan--Skeptics Note Finance Aide Also Is Going

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Uruguay is so democratic that it does not even have a President in the sense of an executive like our own, with strong powers. The distinguished and welcome visitor who arrives in Washington from Montevideo today, Luis Batlle-Berres, is President of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay is so democratic that it does not even have a President in the sense of an executive like our own, with strong powers. The distinguished and welcome visitor who arrives in Washington from Montevideo today, Luis Batlle-Berres, is President of the National Council of Government and he can serve for only one year, like the President of Switzerland whose government Uruguay has partly copied.

headline.main: Uruguayan Head Flying to U. S.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP) -- President Luis Batlle Berres of Uruguay received an impressive military welcome and greetings from high United States officials on his arrival today for a state visit.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP) -- President Luis Batlle Berres of Uruguay received an impressive military welcome and greetings from high United States officials on his arrival today for a state visit.
docs.abstract: he reaches Washington; greeted by Vice Pres Nixon; itinerary
